content: i created this blanket inspired by avatar the last airbender in 2007 during the long drought between seasons 2 and 3 as a way to hold myself over i made it available as a pattern so that other fans could make their own blanket and i can t believe so many people have taken on this project this project is a time investment but a lot of fun and i m so happy to see so many people enjoy making a blanket of their own i updated this pattern to create an easier to manage pdf version rather than the old blog post version it is now available as a free downloadable pdf on ravelry i ve also tried to fix some errors to the best i can given i no longer have the original chart files available also i will say this was one of my very first fiber arts projects and i was making up a lot of this as i went along so some approaches here may not be the best or standard way to do this i say this in the context of using cluster sts for the foreground colors and carrying the 2nd color of yarn all the way through if you look through some ravelers projects on here they ve had success using half_double_crochet in place of the cluster sts and not carrying the yarn through large sections of one color which might cause uneven thickness but will save some time and yarn others used tunisian crochet i d say to experiment a bit with this and do what feels right to you it is your blanket i d like to also point out that ravelry user terif created a knitted version 1 and wrote some notes on her modifications at the link kim nov 2021 -- for posterity here is the old version of the pattern https //kimby77 wordpress com/2008/01/15/avatar-the-four-elements/ 1 https //www ravelry com/projects/terif/avatar-the-four-elements
